SEARCH
Package com.domino.app.model

Class Boneyard

java.lang.Object
com.domino.app.model.Boneyard
public class Boneyard extends Object
Represents the boneyard in a domino game, which holds a collection of domino tiles. The boneyard typically stores the unused tiles from which players can draw during the game.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Boneyard()
    Initializes a new boneyard with an empty list of tiles.

  • Constructor Details

    • Boneyard

      public Boneyard()
      Initializes a new boneyard with an empty list of tiles.

  • Method Details

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the boneyard is empty.
      Returns:
      true if the boneyard has no tiles, false otherwise.

    • getTiles

      public List<Tile> getTiles()
      Gets an unmodifiable view of the tiles in the boneyard.
      Returns:
      A read-only list of tiles in the boneyard.

    • getTileCount

      public int getTileCount()
      Gets the count of tiles currently in the boneyard.
      Returns:
      The number of tiles in the boneyard.

    • addTile

      public boolean addTile(Tile tile)
      Adds a new tile to the boneyard.
      Parameters:
      tile - The tile to be added.
      Returns:
      true if the tile was successfully added, false otherwise.

    • releaseTile

      public Tile releaseTile()
      Removes and returns the first tile from the boneyard. If the boneyard is empty, it returns null.
      Returns:
      The first tile from the boneyard, or null if it is empty.

    • shuffleTiles

      public void shuffleTiles()
      Randomly shuffles the tiles in the boneyard. This method rearranges the order of the tiles in the boneyard randomly. It uses the Collections.shuffle(List) method for randomization.
